OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority

DevelopmentDescription: "Erection of 10 dwellings with associated parking"

DevelopmentDescription: "Demolition of existing open air car sales and motor repair workshop and erection of 27 sheltered apartments for the elderly"

DevelopmentDescription: "Change of Use From Place of Worship to Residential and Construct Block of Six Flats"

DevelopmentDescription: "Prior Approval for Change of Use from Offices (B1) to Residential Comprising of 24 x One Bedroom Apartments "
NonHousingDevelopment: Ground floor uses below this change of use are class A retail

OwnershipStatus: owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: "demolition of existing buildings and redevelopment to provide 210 dwellings"

OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: "Developability of this site will depend on the viability of the existing uses. Theoretical density (90% of site at 60 DPH) = 45. Given edge of Green Belt location assume 35."

SiteNameAddress: "Dorset Soldier PH, Wareham Road, Corfe Mullen"
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: "Assessed potential of up to 12 dwellings which is realistic for a flatted scheme."
Notes: Site submitted by landowner as part of Local Plan Review 2017

OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: "Potential assessed for 20 flats"
Notes: "Garage site has potential for re-development, subject to the viability of the business.  However, conversion to flats of the adjacent property suggests some likelihood that it will happen."

OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: "Approximately 25 dwellings."
Notes: "This site is occupied by the Blackhill Industrial Estate and the adjacent builder's supplies depot. It is unlikely that the industrial estate will come forward for redevelopment in the near future. There is a greater likelihood is the builders merchants"

SiteNameAddress: "Northern Portion Flight Refuelling Site, Brook Road, Wimborne"
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: "Approximately 50 dwellings."
Notes: "Landowner has also expressed an interest in releasing the land for housing or a foodstore. There is a current live application for additional parking so consider only 50% of the site available for housing currently so approximately 50 dwellings."

OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: "A well located site with excellent links to the town centre and transport links. However the landowner has expressed viability issues in the current economic climate."

OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: "Potential for complete redevelopment of site for flats or mews cottages"

OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: "Potential for a number of units on this site close to the town centre if the business were to relocate."

OwnershipStatus: owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: "The Furzehill Council Offices were considered surplus to requirements following the partnership working between Christchurch and East Dorset Councils."

SiteNameAddress: "Post Office and Co-op, Smugglers Lane, Colehill"
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: "The Post Office and shop are unlikely to come forward in the near future as the building has recently been refurbished and just retained the post office. It may come forward towards the end of the period for flats."

OwnershipStatus: owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: "This site forms new neighbourhood CM1 in the adopted Core Strategy. Lockyers School element of site is expected to come forward towards the end of the plan period"
Notes: Net dwellings potential only for brownfield element of the CM1 allocation

SiteNameAddress: "The Post Office and 124 Ringwood Road, Longham"
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: "The site lies partially within the existing settlement boundary and partially within the green belt in an where an Exceptions Site may be acceptable"

OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: "Area to west outside of builders merchants site could come forward on its own. 25.08.17 Updated capacity to 80 units as within 60dph density zone and within urban area."
Notes: Two dwellings removed from original SHLAA site

SiteNameAddress: "Stone Lane Industrial Estate, Stone Lane, Pamphill"
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: "This is site of the new neighbourhood WMC6 at Stone Lane in the adopted Core Strategy. Scheduled for end of Plan period."

OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: "The site is within the existing settlement boundary, but the southern half of the site is affected by flood risk. There is though potential to convert the existing building into flats."

SiteNameAddress: "Tap and Railway Public House, 195 Station Road, West Moors"
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: "This pub site would be suitable for high density flats, possibly over shops, as it lies between a sheltered housing scheme and a parade of shops with flats over in the commercial centre of the village"

SiteNameAddress: "West Moors Library, Station Road, West Moors"
OwnershipStatus: owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: "The Library site could be redeveloped for library/community uses on the ground floor with flats above. However, this is unlikely to happen until towards the end of the Plan period."
NonHousingDevelopment: Ground floor community use required in the form of a library

OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: "Allocated as a car park in the current Local Plan, will retain an important town centre car park function with the re ordering of The Square, where parking will be lost. Part of the site is Flood zone 3."
NonHousingDevelopment: Potential for some ground floor commercial development with flats over

OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: "Away from the listed building, there is potential on the yard to the east."
Notes: "Half the original SHLAA site is within the curtilage of the Grade II* LB which has been removed from this brownfield entry"

SiteNameAddress: "Old Road Car Park and Old Dairy, Wimborne"
OwnershipStatus: mixed ownership
DevelopmentDescription: "EDDC have determined to dispose of the car park for housing (approx 8 units). The  builder's office (former dairy) is now available, the latter may be towards the end of the plan period."
Notes: Marks Yard element of SHLAA site removed and shown as a separate Brownfield entry

OwnershipStatus: owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: "Potential to replace the old school buildings with sympathetically designed dwellings that will enhance the townscape and surveillance of the park."

OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: "Potential with the Builders Hire Depot in the centre of the site -  rather than with the Victorian cottages or modern flats"

OwnershipStatus: owned by a public authority
